description: Clear model-state information. Model information is cleared, allowing one to begin a new problem. The optional 'force' keyword suppresses the model reset confirmation dialog (which will normally appear if the model has changed since the last save when the model new command is used). Values associated with the project or program state are unaffected by the model new command. Model-state information includes any defined FISH functions and variables, histories, and tables.

keywords.name: force
keywords.description: Suppress the model reset confirmation dialog (which normally appears if model has changed since last save)

notes: Allows starting a new problem from scratch
- All model objects (balls, clumps, walls, contacts, etc.)
Values associated with PROJECT or PROGRAM state are NOT affected (see 'project new' and 'program' commands)
force keyword: suppresses confirmation dialog if model changed since last save
IMPORTANT: When running several different problems from a called file, 'model new' must be given BEFORE each new problem
Entire model state can be saved via 'model save' and restored via 'model restore'
Alternative: FISH can write/read data to files (see File Utilities) for selective data preservation
Deterministic mode is reset to default setting after 'model new'

examples.description: Clear model and start fresh (may show confirmation dialog)

examples.command:
model new
model domain extent -10 10
ball generate number 1000 radius 0.5
examples.description: Clear model and setup new problem

examples.command:
model save 'problem1.sav'
model new force
; setup problem 2
model save 'problem2.sav'
examples.description: Save current problem, clear, setup new problem

examples.command:
; Running multiple problems from a data file
model new force
; Problem 1 setup and solve
model solve

model new force
; Problem 2 setup and solve
model solve
examples.description: Multiple problems in one data file - use 'model new' before each

examples.command:
program call 'problem1.dat'
model new force
program call 'problem2.dat'
examples.description: Call multiple problem files with 'model new' between them

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('model new') or itasca.command('model new force') - Python SDK does not provide direct model.new() function
